title: Chemical fibers global production 2000 to 2018
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Fiber Types on X-axis for 10 groups 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Production in thousand metric tons.
In Fiber Type Total, 2018 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons 73400.0 among the 10 groups and in Cellulose fibers, 2000 had the lowest Production in thousand metric tons 2640.0.
Among all the Fiber Types, 2011 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons 52700.0 in Fiber Type Total and lowest value 4743.0 in Fiber Type Cellulose fibers.
Fiber Type Total and Cellulose fibers had the biggest gap of 47957.0 between the highest and lowest Production in thousand metric tons found for 2011.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Fiber Types on X-axis for 10 groups 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Production in thousand metric tons.
Out of all 10 groups, 2018 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons in Fiber Type Total and 2000 had the lowest Production in thousand metric tons in Fiber Type Cellulose fibers.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Fiber Types on X-axis for 10 groups 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Production in thousand metric tons.
In Fiber Type Total, 2018 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons 73400.0 among the 10 groups and in Cellulose fibers, 2000 had the lowest Production in thousand metric tons 2640.0.
Among all the Fiber Types, 2011 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons 52700.0 in Fiber Type Total and lowest value 4743.0 in Fiber Type Cellulose fibers.
Fiber Type Total and Cellulose fibers had the biggest gap of 47957.0 between the highest and lowest Production in thousand metric tons found for 2011.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Production in thousand metric tons on the Y-axis for 3 different Fiber Types for 10 groups 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 10 groups, 2018 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons in Fiber Type Total and 2000 had the lowest Production in thousand metric tons in Fiber Type Cellulose fibers.
In Fiber Type Total, 2011 had the highest Production in thousand metric tons among all 3 Fiber Types and it has the lowest Production in thousand metric tons in Fiber Type Cellulose fibers.
Fiber Type Total and Cellulose fibers had the biggest gap of 47957.0 between the highest and lowest Production in thousand metric tons found for 2011.
Among all 10 groups, 2017 had the gap of 64900.0 between the maximum and minimum Production in thousand metric tons observed in Fiber Type Total and Cellulose fibers respectively.

2018 had the maximum Production in thousand metric tons out of all 10 groups in Fiber Type Total followed by 2018 in Total, and the minimum Production in thousand metric tons is found for 2000 in Cellulose fibers.

Averaging all 10 groups 2000, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018, the Fiber Type Total is the maximum Production in thousand metric tons and Cellulose fibers is the minimum Production in thousand metric tons.
